skillTree.localised_description: Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fly.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Mighty, horned, reptilian beasts, Stegadons are naturally armoured with bony scales and spikes protruding from their crests.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.

skillTree.localised_description: Only the eldest, largest and most ferocious of their kind can move the Engines of the Gods!

effects.description: Mount: Ancient Stegadon (Engine of the Gods)

skillTree.localised_description: Lizardmen can move with deceptive speed and agility when they have to.
Across the gulf of space, the serene Potec has shared the secrets of time so that the Lizardmen may protect themselves against supernatural attack.

effects.description:
Ambush defence chance: +5%
	(all units in army)

Ambush defence chance: +10%
	(all units in army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Sotek marks his finest servants with divine blessings.
Sometimes it's possible to bend time.

skillTree.localised_description: Those of particular skill deciphering the will of the Slann are held in high regard amongst their kin.

effects.description:

	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A crew of skinks serve the priest, collecting healing herbs and distributing them to the host.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Skink, Chameleon Skink, Red Crested Skink and Bastiladon (Ark of Sotek) units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Stay in one place, gods-damn you!"
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
Never trap this one, when cornered they have nothing left to lose.
Utilizing a complex network of skink workers, supplies for the smallest Lizardmen can be easily procured.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Skink and Chameleon Skinks units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: As more territory returns to the Lizardmen, more spawning pools are restored.

	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Drain the winds of magic before the enemy can turn them against us.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -5
	(enemy armies in region)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Practiced in the art of casting; always with a spell at the ready.
Your life is balanced on the edge of a knife when drawing from the winds. Too swift, and the winds will claim your life. Too slow, and the enemy will.

skillTree.localised_description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.
